action_label: Create your first Bill of Materials
description:
# Create a Bill of Materials

A Bill of Materials (BOM) is a list of items and sub-assemblies with quantities required to manufacture an Item.

BOM also provides cost estimation for the production of the item. It takes raw-materials cost based on valuation and operations to cost based on routing, which gives total costing for a BOM.
name: Create BOM
title: Bill of Materials

description:
# Create Items for Bill of Materials

One of the prerequisites of a BOM is the creation of raw materials, sub-assembly, and finished items. Once these items are created, you will be able to proceed to the Bill of Materials master, which is composed of items and routing.
name: Create Product
title: Finished Items

description:
# Buying Settings


Buying module’s features are highly configurable as per your business needs. Buying Settings is the place where you can set your preferences for:

- Supplier naming and default values
- Billing and shipping preference in buying transactions
name: Introduction to Buying
title: Buying Settings

description:
# Create Workstations

A Workstation stores information regarding the place where the workstation operations are performed. As an example, if you have ten sewing machines doing stitching jobs, each machine will be added as a workstation.
name: Workstation
title: Workstation

description:
# Create Operations

An Operation refers to any manufacturing operation performed on the raw materials to process it further in the manufacturing path. As an example, if you are into garments manufacturing, you will create Operations like fabric cutting, stitching, and washing as some of the operations.
name: Operation
title: Operation

description:
# Create a Work Order

A Work Order or a Job order is given to the manufacturing shop floor by the Production Manager to initiate the manufacturing of a certain quantity of an item. Work Order carriers details of production Item, its BOM, quantities to be manufactured, and operations.

Through Work Order, you can track various production status like:

- Issue of raw-material to shop material
- Progress on each Workstation via Job Card
- Manufactured Quantity against Work Order
name: Work Order
title: Work Order

description:
## Products and Services

Depending on the nature of your business, you might be selling products or services to your clients or even both. 
ERPNext is optimized for itemized management of your sales and purchase.

The **Item Master**  is where you can add all your sales items. If you are in services, you can create an Item for each service that you offer. If you run a manufacturing business, the same master is used for keeping a record of raw materials, sub-assemblies etc.

Completing the Item Master is very essential for the successful implementation of SWOT ERP. We have a brief video introducing the item master for you, you can watch it in the next step.
name: Create a Product
title: Create a Sales Item

action_label: Let’s create your first Purchase Order
description:
# Create first Purchase Order

Purchase Order is at the heart of your buying transactions. In SWOT ERP, Purchase Order can can be created against a Purchase Material Request (indent) and Supplier Quotation as well.  Purchase Orders is also linked to Purchase Receipt and Purchase Invoices, allowing you to keep a birds-eye view on your purchase deals.
name: Create your first Purchase Order
title: Create first Purchase Order

description:
# Setting up Taxes

SWOT ERP lets you configure your taxes so that they are automatically applied in your buying and selling transactions. You can configure them globally or even on Items. SWOT ERP taxes are pre-configured for most regions.
name: Setup Taxes
title: Setting up Taxes

description:
# All about sales invoice

A Sales Invoice is a bill that you send to your Customers against which the Customer makes the payment. Sales Invoice is an accounting transaction. On submission of Sales Invoice, the system updates the receivable and books income against a Customer Account.
name: Create Your First Sales Invoice
title: Create Your First Sales Invoice

description:
# Account Settings

This is a crucial piece of configuration. There are various account settings in SWOT ERP to restrict and configure actions in the Accounting module.

The following settings are avaialble for you to configure

1. Account Freezing 
2. Credit and Overbilling
3. Invoicing and Tax Automations
4. Balance Sheet configurations

There's much more, you can check it all out in this step
name: Configure Account Settings
title: Configure Account Settings

action_label: Let’s create your first Purchase Invoice
description:
# Create your first Purchase Invoice

A Purchase Invoice is a bill received from a Supplier for a product(s) or service(s) delivery to your company. You can track payables through Purchase Invoice and process Payment Entries against it.

Purchase Invoices can also be created against a Purchase Order or Purchase Receipt.
name: Create Your First Purchase Invoice
title: Create Your First Purchase Invoice

description:
# Introduction to Stock Entry
This video will give a quick introduction to [**Stock Entry**](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/user/manual/en/stock/stock-entry).
name: Introduction to Stock Entry
title: Introduction to Stock Entry

action_label: Take a walk through Stock Settings
description:
# Review Stock Settings

In SWOT ERP, the Stock module’s features are configurable as per your business needs. Stock Settings is the place where you can set your preferences for:
- Default values for Item and Pricing
- Default valuation method for inventory valuation
- Set preference for serialization and batching of item
- Set tolerance for over-receipt and delivery of items
name: Stock Settings
title: Review Stock Settings

description:
# Manage Stock Movements
Stock entry allows you to register the movement of stock for various purposes like transfer, received, issues, repacked, etc. To address issues related to theft and pilferages,  you can always ensure that the movement of goods happens against a document reference Stock Entry in SWOT ERP.

Let’s get a quick walk-through on the various scenarios covered in Stock Entry by watching [*this video*](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Njt107hlY3I).
name: Create a Stock Entry
title: Manage Stock Movements

action_label: Let’s create your first Material Request
description:
# Track Material Request


Also known as Purchase Request or an Indent, is a document identifying a requirement of a set of items (products or services) for various purposes like procurement, transfer, issue, or manufacturing. Once the Material Request is validated, a purchase manager can take the next actions for purchasing items like requesting RFQ from a supplier or directly placing an order with an identified Supplier.
name: Create a Material Request
title: Track Material Request

action_label: Take a walk-through of Manufacturing Settings
description:
# Review Manufacturing Settings

In SWOT ERP, the Manufacturing module’s features are configurable as per your business needs. Manufacturing Settings is the place where you can set your preferences for:

- Capacity planning for allocating jobs to workstations
- Raw-material consumption based on BOM or actual
- Default values and over-production allowance
name: Explore Manufacturing Settings
title: Manufacturing Settings

description:
# Selling Settings

CRM and Selling module’s features are configurable as per your business needs. Selling Settings is the place where you can set your preferences for:
 - Customer naming and default values
 - Billing and shipping preference in sales transactions
name: Selling Settings
title: Selling Settings

description:
# View Warehouse
In SWOT ERP the term 'warehouse' can be thought of as a storage location.

Warehouses are arranged in SWOT ERP in a tree like structure, where multiple sub-warehouses can be grouped under a single warehouse.

In this step we will view the [**Warehouse Tree**](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/user/manual/en/stock/warehouse#21-tree-view) to view the [**Warehouses**](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/user/manual/en/stock/warehouse) that are set by default.
name: View Warehouses
title: View Warehouses

description:
# Setup a Warehouse
The warehouse can be your location/godown/store where you maintain the item's inventory, and receive/deliver them to various parties.

In SWOT ERP, you can maintain a Warehouse in the tree structure, so that location and sub-location of an item can be tracked. Also, you can link a Warehouse to a specific Accounting ledger, where the real-time stock value of that warehouse’s item will be reflected.
name: Create a Warehouse
title: Setup a Warehouse

action_label: Let’s create a stock opening entry
description:
# Update Stock Opening Balance
It’s an entry to update the stock balance of an item, in a warehouse, on a date and time you are going live on SWOT ERP.

Once opening stocks are updated, you can create transactions like manufacturing and stock deliveries, where this opening stock will be consumed.
name: Stock Opening Balance
title: Update Stock Opening Balance

action_label: Take a quick walk-through of Accounts Settings
description:
# Account Settings

In SWOT ERP, Accounting features are configurable as per your business needs. Accounts Settings is the place to define some of your accounting preferences like:

 - Credit Limit and over billing settings
 - Taxation preferences
 - Deferred accounting preferences
name: Accounts Settings
title: Accounts Settings

description:
A Sales Order is a confirmation of an order from your customer. It is also referred to as Proforma Invoice.

Sales Order at the heart of your sales and purchase transactions. Sales Orders are linked in Delivery Note, Sales Invoices, Material Request, and Maintenance transactions. Through Sales Order, you can track fulfillment of the overall deal towards the customer.
name: Create a Sales Order
title: Create a Sales Order

action_label: Learn how to update opening balances
description:
# Updating Opening Balances

Once you close the financial statement in previous accounting software, you can update the same as opening in your SWOT ERP's Balance Sheet accounts. This will allow you to get complete financial statements from SWOT ERP in the coming years, and discontinue the parallel accounting system right away.
name: Updating Opening Balances
title: Updating Opening Balances

description: # Cost Centers for Budgeting and Analysis While your Books of Accounts are framed to fulfill statutory requirements, you can set up Cost Center and Accounting Dimensions to address your companies reporting and budgeting requirements. Click here to learn more about how [Cost Center](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/v13/user/manual/en/accounts/cost-center) and [Dimensions](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/v13/user/manual/en/accounts/accounting-dimensions) allow you to get advanced financial analytics reports from SWOT ERP.
name: Cost Centers for Report and Budgeting
title: Cost Centers for Budgeting and Analysis

description: # Financial Statements In SWOT ERP, you can get crucial financial reports like [Balance Sheet] and [Profit and Loss] statements with a click of a button. You can run in the report for a different period and plot analytics charts premised on statement data. For more reports, check sections like Financial Statements, General Ledger, and Profitability reports. [Check Accounting reports](https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/v13/user/manual/en/accounts/accounting-reports)
name: Financial Statements
title: Financial Statements

description:
# Setup Routing

A Routing stores all Operations along with the description, hourly rate, operation time, batch size, etc. Click below to learn how the Routing template can be created, for quick selection in the BOM.
name: Routing
title: Routing

description:
# How Production Planning Works

Production Plan helps in production and material planning for the Items planned for manufacturing. These production items can be committed via Sales Order (to Customers) or Material Requests (internally).
name: Production Planning
title: Production Planning

action_label: Let’s convert your first Sales Order against a Quotation
description:
# Sales Order

A Sales Order is a confirmation of an order from your customer. It is also referred to as Proforma Invoice.

Sales Order at the heart of your sales and purchase transactions. Sales Orders are linked in Delivery Note, Sales Invoices, Material Request, and Maintenance transactions. Through Sales Order, you can track fulfillment of the overall deal towards the customer.
name: Sales Order
title: Sales Order

action_label: Let's walk-through Chart of Accounts to review setup
description:
# Fixed Asset Accounts

With the company, a host of fixed asset accounts are pre-configured. To ensure your asset transactions are leading to correct accounting entries, you can review and set up following asset accounts as per your business  requirements.
 - Fixed asset accounts (Asset account)
 - Accumulated depreciation
 - Capital Work in progress (CWIP) account
 - Asset Depreciation account (Expense account)
name: Fixed Asset Accounts
title: Review Fixed Asset Accounts

description:
# Asset Category

An Asset Category classifies different assets of a Company.

You can create an Asset Category based on the type of assets. For example, all your desktops and laptops can be part of an Asset Category named "Electronic Equipments". Create a separate category for furniture. Also, you can update default properties for each category, like:
 - Depreciation type and duration
 - Fixed asset account
 - Depreciation account
name: Asset Category
title: Define Asset Category

action_label: Let's create a new Asset item
description:
# Asset Item

Asset items are created based on Asset Category. You can create one or multiple items against once Asset Category. The sales and purchase transaction for Asset is done via Asset Item.
name: Asset Item
title: Create an Asset Item

description:
# Purchase an Asset

Assets purchases process if done following the standard Purchase cycle. If capital work in progress is enabled in Asset Category, Asset will be created as soon as Purchase Receipt is created for it. You can quickly create a Purchase Receipt for Asset and see its impact on books of accounts.
name: Asset Purchase
title: Purchase an Asset

description:
# Add an Existing Asset

If you are just starting with SWOT ERP, you will need to enter Assets you already possess. You can add them as existing fixed assets in SWOT ERP. Please note that you will have to make a Journal Entry separately updating the opening balance in the fixed asset account.
name: Existing Asset
title: Add an Existing Asset

description:
# Check Stock Reports
Based on the various stock transactions, you can get a host of one-click Stock Reports in SWOT ERP like Stock Ledger, Stock Balance, Projected Quantity, and Ageing analysis.
name: View Stock Projected Qty
report_description: You can set the filters to narrow the results, then click on Generate New Report to see the updated report.
title: Check Stock Projected Qty

action_label: Learn how to add Custom Fields
description:
Every form in SWOT ERP has a standard set of fields. If you need to capture some information, but there is no standard Field available for it, you can insert Custom Field for it.

Once custom fields are added, you can use them for reports and analytics charts as well.
name: Custom Field
title: Create Custom Fields

action_label: Learn more about creating new DocTypes
description: A DocType (Document Type) is used to insert forms in SWOT ERP. Forms such as Customer, Orders, and Invoices are Doctypes in the backend. You can also create new DocTypes to create new forms in SWOT ERP as per your business needs.
name: Custom Doctype
title: Custom Document Types

description: Each document created in SWOT ERP can have a unique ID generated for it, using a prefix defined for it. Though each document has some prefix pre-configured, you can further customize it using tools like Naming Series Tool and Document Naming Rule.
name: Naming Series
title: Setup Naming Series

description: Workflows allow you to define custom rules for the approval process of a particular document in SWOT ERP. You can also set complex Workflow Rules and set approval conditions.
name: Workflows
title: Setup Approval Workflows

description: In SWOT ERP, you can add your Employees as Users, and give them restricted access. Tools like Role Permission and User Permission allow you to define rules which give restricted access to the user to masters and transactions.
name: Role Permissions
title: Setup Limited Access for a User

action_label: Learn about Standard and Custom Print Formats
description: Print Formats allow you can define looks for documents when printed or converted to PDF. You can also create a custom Print Format using drag-and-drop tools.
name: Print Format
title: Customize Print Formats

description: In each module, you will find a host of single-click reports, ranging from financial statements to sales and purchase analytics and stock tracking reports. If a required new report is not available out-of-the-box, you can create custom reports in SWOT ERP by pulling values from the same multiple SWOT ERP tables.
name: Report Builder
title: Generate Custom Reports

description:
# CRM Settings

CRM module’s features are configurable as per your business needs. CRM Settings is the place where you can set your preferences for:
- Campaign
- Lead
- Opportunity
- Quotation
name: CRM Settings
title: CRM Settings

description:
# Check Stock Reports
Based on the various stock transactions, you can get a host of one-click Stock Reports in SWOT ERP like Stock Ledger, Stock Balance, Projected Quantity, and Ageing analysis.
name: Check Stock Ledger Report
report_description: Stock Ledger report contains every submitted stock transaction. You can use filter to narrow down ledger entries.
title: Check Stock Ledger

action_label: Learn more about Chart of Accounts
callback_message: You can continue with the onboarding after exploring this page
description:
# Chart Of Accounts

SWOT ERP sets up a simple chart of accounts for each Company you create, but you can modify it according to business and legal requirements.
name: Chart of Accounts
title: Review Chart of Accounts

description:
# Create a Customer

The Customer master is at the heart of your sales transactions. Customers are linked in Quotations, Sales Orders, Invoices, and Payments. Customers can be either numbered or identified by name (you would typically do this based on the number of customers you have).

Through Customer’s master, you can effectively track essentials like:
 - Customer’s multiple address and contacts
 - Account Receivables
 - Credit Limit and Credit Period
name: Create a Customer
title: Create a Customer

description:
# Create a Supplier

Also known as Vendor, is a master at the center of your purchase transactions. Suppliers are linked in Request for Quotation, Purchase Orders, Receipts, and Payments. Suppliers can be either numbered or identified by name.

Through Supplier’s master, you can effectively track essentials like:
 - Supplier’s multiple address and contacts
 - Account Receivables
 - Credit Limit and Credit Period
name: Create a Supplier
title: Create a Supplier

description:
# Create a Quotation

Let’s get started with business transactions by creating your first Quotation. You can create a Quotation for an existing customer or a prospect. It will be an approved document, with items you sell and the proposed price + taxes applied. After completing the instructions, you will get a Quotation in a ready to share print format.
name: Create a Quotation
title: Create your first Quotation

description:
# Create an Item

Item is a product or a service offered by your company, or something you buy as a part of your supplies or raw materials.

Items are integral to everything you do in SWOT ERP - from billing, purchasing to managing inventory. Everything you buy or sell, whether it is a physical product or a service is an Item. Items can be stock, non-stock, variants, serialized, batched, assets, etc.
name: Create an Item
title: Create an Item

description:
# Import Data from Spreadsheet

In SWOT ERP, you can easily migrate your historical data using spreadsheets. You can use it for migrating not just masters (like Customer, Supplier, Items), but also for transactions like (outstanding invoices, opening stock and accounting entries, etc).
name: Data import
title: Import Data from Spreadsheet

description:
# Set Up a Company

A company is a legal entity for which you will set up your books of account and create accounting transactions. In SWOT ERP, you can create multiple companies, and establish relationships (group/subsidiary) among them.

Within the company master, you can capture various default accounts for that Company and set crucial settings related to the accounting methodology followed for a company.
name: Company Set Up
title: Set Up a Company

description:
# Navigation in SWOT ERP

Ease of navigating and browsing around the SWOT ERP is one of our core strengths. In the following video, you will learn how to reach a specific feature in SWOT ERP via module page or AwesomeBar.
name: Navigation Help
title: How to Navigate in SWOT ERP

action_label: Let’s setup your first Letter Head
description:
# Create a Letter Head

A Letter Head contains your organization's name, logo, address, etc which appears at the header and footer portion in documents. You can learn more about Setting up Letter Head in SWOT ERP here.
name: Letterhead
title: Setup Your Letterhead
